hi!! have you solve this problem??
if not , you can do this:
add the TestTest's class into the java's line like this : java -cp ~/Desktop/Downloads/junit3.8.1:. junit.textui.TestRunner ;TestTest's classpath TestTest

bye!!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Ryan Platte 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, March 16, 2005 5:52 AM
  Subject: [junit] Can't run anything from textui?



  Hello, I'm tearing my hair out over this --

  1. TestTest.java is the following: =====

  public class TestTest extends junit.framework.TestCase {
        public void testRunnin() {
              assertFalse("failure works!", true);
        }
  }

  =====

  2. I compile it with "javac TestTest.java". TestTest.class appears.

  3. I  do:
  $ java -cp ~/Desktop/Downloads/junit3.8.1:. junit.textui.TestRunner 
  TestTest

  and get:
  Class not found "TestTest"

  4. I do:
  $ java -cp ~/Desktop/Downloads/junit3.8.1:. junit.swingui.TestRunner 
  TestTest

  and get the failure I expect ("failure works!").

  HUH? I will be very grateful for help with this one, my head is getting 
  raw from scratching.

  Latest Mac OS X, junit 3.8.1.

  -- 
  Ryan Platte
  Site 9
